memberdef.name: LV_LABEL_HINT_HEIGHT_LIMIT
memberdef.initializer: 1024 /*Enable "hint" to buffer info about labels larger than this. (Speed up their drawing)*/

detaileddescription.para:
Signal function of the label
label
pointer to a label object
sign
a signal type from lv_signal_t enum
param
pointer to a signal specific variable
LV_RES_OK: the object is not deleted in the function; LV_RES_INV: the object is deleted

Handle the drawing related tasks of the labels
label
pointer to a label object
mask
the object will be drawn only in this area
mode
LV_DESIGN_COVER_CHK: only check if the object fully covers the 'mask_p' area (return 'true' if yes) LV_DESIGN_DRAW: draw the object (always return 'true') LV_DESIGN_DRAW_POST: drawing after every children are drawn
return
true/false, depends on 'mode'

Refresh the label with its text stored in its extended data
label
pointer to a label object
Store len characters from data. Allocates space if necessary.

Get the stored dot_tmp characters
label
pointer to label object
char pointer to a stored characters. Is not necessarily NULL-terminated.

Free the dot_tmp_ptr field if it was previously allocated. Always clears the field
label
pointer to label object.

Create a label objects
par
pointer to an object, it will be the parent of the new label
copy
pointer to a button object, if not NULL then the new object will be copied from it
pointer to the created button

Set a new text for a label. Memory will be allocated to store the text by the label.
label
pointer to a label object
text
'\0' terminated character string. NULL to refresh with the current text.

Set a new text for a label from a character array. The array don't has to be '\0' terminated. Memory will be allocated to store the array by the label.
label
pointer to a label object
array
array of characters or NULL to refresh the label
size
the size of 'array' in bytes

Set a static text. It will not be saved by the label so the 'text' variable has to be 'alive' while the label exist.
label
pointer to a label object
text
pointer to a text. NULL to refresh with the current text.

Set the behavior of the label with longer text then the object size
label
pointer to a label object
long_mode
the new mode from 'lv_label_long_mode' enum. In LV_LONG_BREAK/LONG/ROLL the size of the label should be set AFTER this function

Set the align of the label (left or center)
label
pointer to a label object
align
'LV_LABEL_ALIGN_LEFT' or 'LV_LABEL_ALIGN_LEFT'

Enable the recoloring by in-line commands
label
pointer to a label object
en
true: enable recoloring, false: disable

Set the label to draw (or not draw) background specified in its style's body
label
pointer to a label object
en
true: draw body; false: don't draw body

Set the label's animation speed in LV_LABEL_LONG_ROLL and SCROLL modes
label
pointer to a label object
anim_speed
speed of animation in px/sec unit

parameterdescription.para: index to set. LV_LABEL_TXT_SEL_OFF to select nothing.
index to set. LV_LABEL_TXT_SEL_OFF to select nothing.

detaileddescription.para:
Get the text of a label
label
pointer to a label object
the text of the label

Get the long mode of a label
label
pointer to a label object
the long mode

Get the align attribute
label
pointer to a label object
LV_LABEL_ALIGN_LEFT or LV_LABEL_ALIGN_CENTER

Get the recoloring attribute
label
pointer to a label object
true: recoloring is enabled, false: disable

Get the body draw attribute
label
pointer to a label object
true: draw body; false: don't draw body

Get the label's animation speed in LV_LABEL_LONG_ROLL and SCROLL modes
label
pointer to a label object
speed of animation in px/sec unit

Get the relative x and y coordinates of a letter
label
pointer to a label object
index
index of the letter [0 ... text length]. Expressed in character index, not byte index (different in UTF-8)
pos
store the result here (E.g. index = 0 gives 0;0 coordinates)

Get the index of letter on a relative point of a label
label
pointer to label object
pos
pointer to point with coordinates on a the label
the index of the letter on the 'pos_p' point (E.g. on 0;0 is the 0. letter) Expressed in character index and not byte index (different in UTF-8)

simplesect.para: selection start index. LV_LABEL_TXT_SEL_OFF if nothing is selected.
selection end index. LV_LABEL_TXT_SEL_OFF if nothing is selected.

detaileddescription.para:
Check if a character is drawn under a point.
label
Label object
pos
Point to check for characte under
whether a character is drawn under the point

Insert a text to the label. The label text can not be static.
label
pointer to a label object
pos
character index to insert. Expressed in character index and not byte index (Different in UTF-8) 0: before first char. LV_LABEL_POS_LAST: after last char.
txt
pointer to the text to insert

Delete characters from a label. The label text can not be static.
label
pointer to a label object
pos
character index to insert. Expressed in character index and not byte index (Different in UTF-8) 0: before first char.
cnt
number of characters to cut
